skill.name: docs-write
skill.description: Write documentation following Metabase's conversational, clear, and user-focused style. Use when creating or editing documentation files (markdown, MDX, etc.).
skill.summary: Write documentation following Metabase's conversational, clear, and user-focused style. Use when cre...
skill.author: metabase

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based documentation skill containing only writing guidelines and style instructions. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or command execution.

content.value_statement: Writing documentation that users can quickly understand and act on is challenging. This skill provides proven guidelines for creating conversational, user-focused documentation that gets readers to answers fast.
actual_capabilities: Apply Metabase writing style to markdown and MDX files
Structure documentation with clear headings and logical flow
Write user-focused instructions that lead with actions
Format code examples and UI elements correctly
Edit documentation for clarity and conciseness
limitations: Does not generate content from scratch without input context
Does not verify code examples by running them
Does not handle translations or localization

use_cases.title: Apply consistent style
use_cases.description: Maintain consistent voice and formatting across all documentation files

use_cases.title: Write user guides
use_cases.description: Create clear API docs and tutorials that non-experts can follow

use_cases.title: Edit documentation
use_cases.description: Review and improve existing docs for clarity and reader-focused content

prompt_templates.title: Write new doc
prompt_templates.prompt: Write documentation for [feature/topic] following Metabase style. Include prerequisites, step-by-step instructions with commands, and troubleshooting tips. Lead with what to do, then explain why.

prompt_templates.title: Edit existing doc
prompt_templates.prompt: Edit this documentation to follow Metabase writing style. Make it more conversational, cut unnecessary content, use clearer headings, and ensure code examples work.

prompt_templates.title: Format consistently
prompt_templates.prompt: Run prettier on this documentation file and verify it follows Metabase style. Check that code blocks, links, and UI element formatting are consistent.

prompt_templates.title: Review for style
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this documentation against Metabase style guide. Identify issues with tone, structure, formatting, and examples. Suggest specific improvements.

output_examples.input: Write documentation for setting up SAML authentication
output: ‚úì Leads with the action: 'Set up SAML before adding users'
‚úì Commands in execution order with clear Then/Next steps
‚úì Bold UI elements, backticks for code only

best_practices: Know your audience and match complexity to their skill level
Lead with what to do, then explain why
Cut anything that does not directly help the reader
anti_patterns: Linking with 'here' instead of descriptive link text

faq.question: What tools does this skill work with?
faq.answer: Supports Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Uses Read, Write, Grep, and Glob tools.

faq.question: Does this skill generate documentation from scratch?
faq.answer: It improves and formats existing documentation. Provide context or source material for new content.

faq.question: How does this differ from other writing assistants?
faq.answer: Follows Metabase-specific style with proven patterns for technical documentation.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a prompt-based skill with no network calls or external data transmission.

faq.question: Can I use this for non-Metabase documentation?
faq.answer: Yes. The writing principles apply broadly to technical documentation and user guides.

faq.question: Does the skill run prettier automatically?
faq.answer: It suggests running prettier. You must execute the command yourself in your environment.
